systemDescription.name: Battery Management Display System
systemDescription.description: The Battery Management Display system in the IVI provides the driver with critical information about the electric vehicle's battery status including state of charge, range estimation, charging status, and energy consumption metrics. It interfaces with the Battery Management System (BMS) to collect, process, and present battery-related information in an intuitive format.
operatingConditions: Various lighting conditions from direct sunlight to night

safetyGoals.description: The Battery Management Display shall present accurate and timely battery status information to the driver
safetyGoals.rationale: Inaccurate battery status information could lead to unexpected vehicle power loss or charging incidents

decomposedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall display accurate state of charge information with minimal delay
The IVI system shall display accurate range estimation based on current driving conditions
The IVI system shall clearly indicate potentially hazardous battery conditions

safetyGoals.description: The Battery Management Display shall prevent driver misinterpretation of battery status information
safetyGoals.rationale: Misinterpreted battery information could lead to inappropriate driving decisions and potential safety hazards

decomposedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall present battery information in a clear, unambiguous format
The IVI system shall provide intuitive alerts for critical battery conditions
The IVI system shall implement consistent display conventions for battery information

hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion with low battery level
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Vehicle unexpectedly loses power due to battery depletion not accurately reflected in display

hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle driving with limited battery range
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver makes inappropriate journey decisions based on incorrect range information

hazardAnalysis.description: Failure to display critical battery temperature warning
hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle charging or in motion with battery thermal issue
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver unaware of potentially hazardous battery thermal condition

hazardAnalysis.description: Confusing or distracting battery alert display
hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion with developing battery issue
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver distracted or confused by ambiguous battery alerts

item.name: Battery Management Display System
item.function: Display battery status information to driver

failureEffects.local: State of charge information differs from actual battery level
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver makes decisions based on incorrect battery status
failureEffects.endEffect: Vehicle could unexpectedly run out of power or charging could be inappropriate

detection: Cross-check SoC data from multiple sources

mitigations.description: Multi-source SoC data fusion with plausibility checks
Conservative range display with safety margin

safetyRequirements.description: The Battery Management Display shall implement data fusion from at least two independent SoC calculation methods
The Battery Management Display shall indicate uncertainty when SoC data sources disagree by more than 5%

potentialCauses: Failure to account for environmental factors

failureEffects.local: Displayed range differs significantly from actual achievable range
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver makes journey decisions based on incorrect range
failureEffects.endEffect: Vehicle stranded due to battery depletion in unsafe location

prevention: Include environmental and driving style factors
detection: Monitor deviation between predicted and actual consumption

mitigations.description: Conservative range estimation with clear uncertainty indication
Dynamic range adjustments based on real-time factors

safetyRequirements.description: The Battery Management Display shall adjust range estimations based on temperature, terrain, driving style, and auxiliary loads
The Battery Management Display shall apply a safety margin to range estimations based on historical prediction accuracy

failureModes.description: Failure to display critical battery warnings

failureEffects.local: Critical battery condition not displayed to driver
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver unaware of potentially hazardous situation
failureEffects.endEffect: Battery damage or safety incident due to continued operation

prevention: Implement dedicated path for critical battery warnings
detection: Independent monitoring of critical battery parameters

mitigations.description: Independent monitoring system for critical battery parameters
Redundant warning paths with different technology

safetyRequirements.description: The Battery Management Display shall implement a dedicated high-priority processing path for critical battery warnings
The Battery Management Display shall provide redundant notification methods for critical battery conditions

failureModes.description: Ambiguous or confusing battery information display
potentialCauses: Poor UI design for battery information
Inconsistent use of units or symbols

failureEffects.local: Battery information difficult to interpret correctly
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver misinterprets battery status or warnings
failureEffects.endEffect: Inappropriate driver actions based on misunderstood battery information

detection: Eye tracking studies during information processing

mitigations.description: Standardized, intuitive display formats for battery information
Clear visual distinction between normal and critical battery states

safetyRequirements.description: The Battery Management Display shall implement standardized icons and color schemes consistent with industry norms for battery information
The Battery Management Display shall provide clear textual explanations accompanying all battery warnings

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Multi-source data fusion and plausibility checking
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System combines SoC data from battery voltage monitoring, coulomb counting, and BMS reported values with plausibility checks to detect discrepancies

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Dynamic range calculation with multiple factors
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System dynamically adjusts range calculation based on temperature, terrain, driving style, HVAC usage, and applies safety margin based on historical accuracy
System implements dedicated processing channel for critical battery warnings with guaranteed maximum latency of 200ms from detection to display
System implements secondary monitoring of critical battery parameters independent of main BMS communication channel as redundancy
System implements standardized visual language for battery information with clear differentiation between normal, advisory, and critical states

testCases.description: Verify SoC data fusion and accuracy
testCases.testProcedure: Compare displayed SoC with reference measurements across various operating conditions
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Displayed SoC accurate within ±3% across operating range

testCases.testProcedure: Induce disagreement between SoC data sources and observe display behavior
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System indicates uncertainty when SoC data sources disagree by more than 5%

testCases.testProcedure: Test range prediction under various conditions (temperature, terrain, driving styles)
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Range estimation adjusts appropriately for all tested conditions

testCases.testProcedure: Compare predicted range with actual achievable range across multiple test drives
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Displayed range includes appropriate safety margin based on prediction accuracy

testCases.testProcedure: Measure end-to-end latency for critical battery warnings
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Critical battery warnings displayed within 200ms of detection

testCases.testProcedure: Simulate critical battery conditions and observe notification methods
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Critical battery conditions trigger at least two distinct notification methods

testCases.testProcedure: Review battery information display against industry standards
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: All battery information displays use standardized icons and color schemes

testCases.testProcedure: Evaluate comprehension of battery warning messages through user testing
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Battery warnings correctly interpreted by 95% of test users
